page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: {Over}is 11 miles N.W. of Cambridge, 10 miles from Huntingdon and 3 miles north of the main A604 Camridge to Huntingdon road. It is a fenland edge settlement which stands on a ridge of higher land rising out of the southern edge of the fens.Nearly all the built up area of the village is above the 70ft. contour.The village is sited on Ampthill clay. In 1969, as with other Cambridgeshire villages, a development plan was produced. Since then, the erection of new housing estates has increased the population rapidly to 2,400. As well as agriculture, there is now work for people on a small industrial estate. Many commute to Cambridge.
